page.title: 09Farming
page.content: On the highland (>250m), beef cattle and hill sheep are kept. On the quite gently sloping land around 100m, grassland is intensively managed for silage or used for potato, barley or oil seed rape production. Dairy cattle and certain lowland sheep, e.g. Suffolks are kept on the steeper valley sides and floor. In places, pigs are reared. Some grains and silage are grown on the valley floor. With a medium sized population, most of the food produced is exported for procesing and marketing. Milk is generally bought by the Co-op Dairy in Whitby, which also makes butter and cream. Animals are sold at Ruswarp Mart. Lambs and beef cattle are mostly bought by local butchers. Wool is usually bought by Northern Wool Growers (Malton). There are market gardens sending produce to Whitby.
